compliance.headline: Government-Grade Security
compliance.confidentiality: We understand government security requirements. All documents are encrypted, access is controlled, and we provide complete audit trails for compliance.

faq.question: Is SummarizePDF approved for government use?
faq.answer: We're FedRAMP Ready and SOC 2 Type II certified, meeting federal security standards. Many state and local governments use us. For federal agencies, contact us about FedRAMP authorization.

faq.question: Can it handle sensitive or classified documents?
faq.answer: We support unclassified but sensitive documents with encryption and access controls. For classified materials, we offer on-premise deployment options. Contact sales for details.

faq.question: How does it help with FOIA requests?
faq.answer: Quickly summarize large document sets to understand content before redaction. Save time on FOIA review while ensuring you don't miss important information.

faq.question: What's the best plan for government agencies?
faq.answer: Most local agencies use the Team plan ($49/mo). State and federal agencies typically need our Enterprise plan with advanced security, SSO, and on-premise options. Contact sales.

faq.question: Can we pay via purchase order or government contract?
faq.answer: Yes! We accept purchase orders and work with government procurement processes. We're also available through GSA Schedule and state cooperative contracts.

faq.question: Is our data stored in the US?
faq.answer: Yes! We offer US-only data residency to meet government requirements. All data stays within US borders with FedRAMP-compliant infrastructure.
